alert.note: Alert for Fillmore; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:47PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern York and northeastern Fillmore Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 347 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beaver Crossing, or 12 miles southeast of York, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern York and northeastern Fillmore Counties. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 360 and 365. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
